metadata.title: CVE-2016-2563 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the SCP command-line utility in PuTTY before0.67 and KiTTY 0.66.6.3 and earlier allows remote servers to cause a denialof service (stack memory corruption) or execute arbitrary code via acrafted SCP-SINK file-size response to an SCP download request.

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
